Part 1 Accusting yourself to C++

Item 1

Item 2

// å‡è®¾fä¸º
int f(int num) { return num; }

#define CALL_WITH_MAX(a, b) f((a) > (b) ? (a) : (b))
// ä¸ºæ‰€æœ‰å®ä¸­çš„å®å‚éƒ½åŠ ä¸Šå°æ‹¬å·
int main(){
	int a = 5, b = 0;

	CALL_WITH_MAX(++a, b+10); // a è¢«ç´¯åŠ ä¸€æ¬¡ï¼Œa == 8ï¼Œ å‡½æ•°è¿”å›10
	
	return 0;
}

è®°ä½ï¼š

  • å•çº¯å¸¸é‡ä½¿ç”¨constå¯¹è±¡æˆ–enum{}æ›¿æ¢#definesã€‚
  • å½¢ä¼¼å‡½æ•°çš„å®ï¼ˆmacrosï¼‰ï¼Œæ”¹ç”¨inlineå‡½æ•°æ›¿æ¢#definesã€‚

Item 3 Use const wherever possible

constçš„çº¦æŸï¼ˆç”±ä½ç½®å†³å®šï¼‰ï¼š

char greeting[] = "Hello";

å¦‚æœconstå‡ºç°åœ¨æ˜Ÿå·å·¦è¾¹ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºè¢«æŒ‡ç‰©æ˜¯å¸¸é‡ï¼›å¦‚æœå‡ºç°åœ¨æ˜Ÿå·å³è¾¹ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºæŒ‡é’ˆè‡ªèº«æ˜¯å¸¸é‡ï¼›ä¸¤è¾¹ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºè¢«æŒ‡ç‰©å’ŒæŒ‡é’ˆè‡ªèº«éƒ½æ˜¯å¸¸é‡ã€‚æ³¨æ„ï¼Œå¦‚æœè¢«æŒ‡ç‰©æ˜¯å¸¸é‡ï¼Œå…³é”®å­—constå†™åœ¨ç±»å‹ä¹‹å‰ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥ï¼Œå³ä»¥ä¸‹ä¸¤ç§å†™æ³•ç›¸åŒï¼š

...

å°†conståº”ç”¨äºæˆå‘˜å‡½æ•°ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ï¼š

  • ä½¿classæ¥å£å®¹æ˜“è¢«ç†è§£ï¼Œå¾—çŸ¥å“ªä¸ªå‡½æ•°å¯ä»¥æ”¹åŠ¨å¯¹è±¡å†…å®¹ï¼Œè€Œå“ªä¸ªä¸è¡Œã€‚
  • ä½¿â€œæ“ä½œconstå¯¹è±¡â€æˆä¸ºå¯èƒ½ã€‚å‰ææ˜¯ï¼šæœ‰constæˆå‘˜å‡½æ•°å¯ç”¨æ¥å¤„ç†å–å¾—çš„constå¯¹è±¡ã€‚ä½¿ç”¨å‡½æ•°é‡è½½ï¼Œå¯¹constå’Œnon-constå¯¹è±¡è¿›è¡Œä¸åŒçš„å¤„ç†ã€‚

Item 4 Initialize objects before used

åŒºåˆ†èµ‹å€¼ä¸åˆå§‹åŒ–ï¼ˆåœ¨ç±»ä¸­ï¼‰ï¼Œèµ‹å€¼ï¼š

class PhoneNumber{...};
class ABEntry{
public:

// æ³¨æ„ï¼Œè¿™ä¸æ˜¯åˆå§‹åŒ–initializationï¼Œæ˜¯èµ‹å€¼assignments
ABEntry::ABEntry(const std::string& name, const std::string& address, const std::list<PhoneNumber>& phones){

è€ŒC++è§„å®šï¼Œå¯¹è±¡çš„æˆå‘˜å˜é‡çš„åˆå§‹åŒ–åŠ¨ä½œå‘ç”Ÿåœ¨è¿›å…¥æ„é€ å‡½æ•°æœ¬ä½“ä¹‹å‰ã€‚ä½¿ç”¨member initialization listæ›¿æ¢èµ‹å€¼æ“ä½œï¼ˆå¦‚æœå¤šé‡ç»§æ‰¿ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨åˆå§‹åŒ–åˆ—è¡¨æ˜¯é¿å…è¿·æƒ‘ç¼–è¯‘å™¨çš„å”¯ä¸€åŠæ³•ï¼‰ï¼š

ABEntry::ABEntry(const std::string& name, const std::string& address, const std::list<PhoneNumber>& phones) :
	theName(name), // åªè°ƒç”¨ä¸€æ¬¡copyæ„é€ å‡½æ•°
	theAddress(address),
	thePhones(phones),
	numTimesConsulted(0)

å¦‚æœæˆå‘˜å˜é‡æ˜¯constæˆ–è€…referencesï¼Œä»–ä»¬å°±ä¸€å®šéœ€è¦åˆå€¼ï¼Œä¸èƒ½è¢«èµ‹å€¼ã€‚æ€»æ˜¯ä½¿ç”¨æˆå‘˜åˆå€¼åˆ—å¯ä»¥é¿å…è¿™äº›é—®é¢˜ã€‚

æ¡æ¬¾4æœ€åæ²¡çœ‹æ‡‚ã€‚å…ˆè¿‡ã€‚

Part 2 Constuctors, Destructors, and Assignment Operators

å‚è€ƒï¼šhttps://blog.csdn.net/lm409/article/details/72598020

Item 5 Know what functions C++ silently writes and calls

C++ç¼–è¯‘å™¨ä¼šä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªç©ºç±»å£°æ˜ï¼ˆç¼–è¯‘å™¨ç‰ˆæœ¬çš„ï¼‰ä¸€ä¸ªcopyæ„é€ å‡½æ•°ã€ä¸€ä¸ªcopy assignmentæ“ä½œç¬¦å’Œä¸€ä¸ªææ„å‡½æ•°ã€‚æ­¤å¤–ï¼Œå¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰å£°æ˜ä»»ä½•æ„é€ å‡½æ•°ï¼Œç¼–è¯‘å™¨ä¹Ÿä¼šå£°æ˜ä¸€ä¸ªdefaultæ„é€ å‡½æ•°ã€‚æ‰€æœ‰è¿™äº›å‡½æ•°éƒ½æ˜¯publicä¸”inlineã€‚å³å¦‚æœä½ å†™ä¸‹ï¼š

class Empty{};

ç­‰åŒäºï¼š

class Empty{
public:
	Empty(){...} // default constructor
	Empty(const Empty& rhs){...} // copy constructor
	~Empty(){...} // destructor, æ˜¯å¦è¯¥æ˜¯virtualè§ç¨åè¯´æ˜
	
	Empty& operator=(const Empty& rhs){...} // copy assignment operator
};

åªæœ‰è¿™äº›å‡½æ•°è¢«éœ€è¦ï¼ˆè¢«è°ƒç”¨ï¼‰æ—¶ï¼Œæ‰ä¼šè¢«ç¼–è¯‘å™¨åˆ›å»ºå‡ºæ¥ã€‚

C++ä¸å…è®¸â€œè®©å¼•ç”¨æ”¹æŒ‡å‘ä¸åŒå¯¹è±¡â€ï¼Œæœ¬è´¨ä¸Šå¼•ç”¨è¿˜æ˜¯å–åœ°å€ï¼Œå·¦å€¼ä¸å¯ä»¥è¢«ä¿®æ”¹ã€‚C++çš„é»˜è®¤copy assignmentä¼šè¢«æ‹’ç»ç¼–è¯‘çš„æƒ…å†µï¼š

  • åœ¨â€œå†…å«referenceæˆå‘˜â€çš„classå†…æ”¯æŒèµ‹å€¼æ“ä½œï¼ˆassignmentï¼‰ã€‚

#include"quickopencv.h"

void QuickDemo::colorSpace_Demo(Mat& image) {
	Mat gray, hsv;
	cvtColor(image, hsv, COLOR_BGR2HSV);
	// H 0~180, S/V both 0~255
	cvtColor(image, gray, COLOR_BGR2GRAY);
	imshow("HSV", hsv);
	imshow("gray", gray);
	imwrite("D:/sjtu/sjtu_files/4_1/opencv_learn/2_cvtColor/hsv.png", hsv);
	imwrite("D:/sjtu/sjtu_files/4_1/opencv_learn/2_cvtColor/gray.png", gray);
}

void QuickDemo::mat_creation_demo(Mat& image) {
	Mat m1, m2;

	image.copyTo(m2);

	// åˆ›å»ºç©ºç™½å›¾åƒ
	Mat m3 = Mat::zeros(Size(8, 8), CV_8UC1); // 8UC1, unsigned, channel oneå•é€šé“,output 8*8
	// if 8UC3, then output 8*24, 1-3 cols are for one singal pixel
	std::cout << m3 << std::endl;

	// è·å–åˆ—æ•°ã€è¡Œæ•°
	std::cout << "Width:" << m3.cols <<  " Height:" << m3.rows << " Channels:" << m3.channels() << std::endl;

	// å°†ä¸‰ä¸ªé€šé“éƒ½èµ‹å€¼ä¸º127
	m3 = Mat::zeros(Size(200, 200), CV_8UC3);
	m3 = Scalar(255, 0, 0); 
	// std::cout << m3 << std::endl;
	std::cout << "Width:" << m3.cols << " Height:" << m3.rows << " Channels:" << m3.channels() << std::endl;
	imshow("m3", m3);

	// è¯æ˜ï¼šç­‰å·è¿ç®—ç¬¦åªæ˜¯æŒ‡é’ˆçš„æŒ‡å‘æ”¹å˜ï¼Œè€Œæ²¡æœ‰æ·±æ‹·è´ï¼›æ”¹å˜m4ä¹Ÿä¼šæ”¹å˜m3
	Mat m4 = m3;
	m4 = Scalar(0, 255, 0);
	imshow("m4", m3); // m3è¢«æ”¹å˜
}

#pragma once

quickdemo.cpp

void QuickDemo::pixel_visit_demo(Mat& image) {
	int w = image.cols;
	int h = image.rows;
	int dims = image.channels();
	for (int row = 0; row < h; row++) {
		for (int col = 0; col < w; col++) {
			if (dims == 1) { // å¯¹å•é€šé“çš„ç°åº¦å›¾
				int pv = image.at<uchar>(row, col);  // atè®¿é—®ucharï¼ˆå­—èŠ‚ç±»å‹ï¼‰ï¼Œè‡ªåŠ¨è½¬æ¢ä¸ºintç±»å‹

				// é‡æ–°èµ‹å€¼ï¼Œæ”¹å˜
				image.at<uchar>(row, col) = 255 - pv;
			}
			else if (dims == 3) { // å½©è‰²å›¾ï¼Œè·å¾—ä¸‰ä¸ªå€¼
				Vec3b bgr = image.at<Vec3b>(row, col);
				// int: Vec3i; float: Vec3f

				// èµ‹å€¼ï¼Œæ”¹å†™
				image.at<Vec3b>(row, col)[0] = 255 - bgr[0];
				image.at<Vec3b>(row, col)[1] = 255 - bgr[1];
				image.at<Vec3b>(row, col)[2] = 255 - bgr[2];
			}
		}
	}

	imshow("åƒç´ è¯»å†™æ¼”ç¤º", image);
}

å¦‚ä½•ä½¿ç”¨æŒ‡é’ˆè®¿é—®åƒç´ ï¼Ÿ
åœ¨quickdemo.cppä¸­ï¼š

void QuickDemo::pixel_visit_demo(Mat& image) {
	int w = image.cols;
	int h = image.rows;
	int dims = image.channels();
	
	// ç¼ºç‚¹ï¼šåˆ¤æ–­dimsåœ¨å¾ªç¯é‡Œé¢ï¼Œåº”è¯¥åœ¨æœ€å¤–å±‚åˆ¤æ–­ï¼Œèµ„æºæµªè´¹ä¸¥é‡
	// ä½¿ç”¨æŒ‡é’ˆ
	if (dims == 1) {
		for (int row = 0; row < h; ++row) {
			uchar* current_pixel = image.ptr<uchar>(row);
			for (int col = 0; col < w; ++col) {
				*current_pixel++ = 255 - *current_pixel;
			}
		}
	}
	else if (dims == 3) {
		for (int row = 0; row < h; ++row) {
			uchar* current_pixel = image.ptr<uchar>(row);
			for (int col = 0; col < w; ++col) {
				*current_pixel++ = 255 - *current_pixel;
				*current_pixel++ = 255 - *current_pixel;
				*current_pixel++ = 255 - *current_pixel;
			}
		}
	}

	imshow("åƒç´ è¯»å†™æ¼”ç¤º", image);
}

å›¾åƒåƒç´ çš„ ç®—æœ¯ æ“ä½œ

çŸ¥è¯†ç‚¹

  • åŠ addï¼Œå‡subtractï¼Œä¹˜multiplyï¼Œé™¤divide
  • saturate_cast

quickopencv.h

#pragma once
#include<opencv2/opencv.hpp>
using namespace cv;

class QuickDemo {
public:
	void colorSpace_Demo(Mat& image);
	void mat_creation_demo(Mat& image);
	void pixel_visit_demo(Mat& image);
	void operators_demo(Mat& image);
};

quickdemo.cpp

void QuickDemo::operators_demo(Mat& image) {
	// åƒç´ æ“ä½œå¯ä»¥æ˜¯åŠ å‡ä¹˜é™¤ï¼Œæ³¨æ„æº¢å‡ºï¼
	Mat dst;

	// åŠ æ³•æ“ä½œï¼Œå˜äº®
	//dst = image + Scalar(50, 50, 50);
	add(image, Scalar(50, 50, 50), dst);
	imshow("åŠ æ³•æ“ä½œ", dst);

	// å‡æ³•æ“ä½œï¼Œå˜æš—
	//dst = image - Scalar(50, 50, 50);
	subtract(image, Scalar(50, 50, 50), dst);
	imshow("å‡æ³•æ“ä½œ", dst);

	// é™¤æ³•åŒç†å‡æ³•ï¼Œå˜æš—
	//dst = image / Scalar(2, 2, 2);
	divide(image, Scalar(2, 2, 2), dst);
	imshow("é™¤æ³•æ“ä½œ", dst);

	// ä¹˜æ³•åŒç†åŠ æ³•ï¼Œå˜äº®
	// ä¸“ç”¨ä¹˜æ³•å‡½æ•°
	Mat m = Mat::zeros(image.size(), image.type());
	m = Scalar(2, 2, 2);
	multiply(image, m, dst);
	imshow("ä¹˜æ³•æ“ä½œ", dst);

	// saturate_castï¼Œä¸Šé™åœ¨ucharèŒƒå›´å†…
	dst = Mat::zeros(image.size(), image.type()); // åˆå§‹åŒ–ï¼Œå¯ä»¥å¿½ç•¥
	m = Mat::zeros(image.size(), image.type());
	m = Scalar(2, 2, 2);
	int w = image.cols;
	int h = image.rows;
	int dims = image.channels();
	for (int row = 0; row < h; ++row) {
		for (int col = 0; col < w; ++col) {
			Vec3b lhs = image.at<Vec3b>(row, col);
			Vec3b rhs = image.at<Vec3b>(row, col);
			dst.at<Vec3b>(row, col)[0] = saturate_cast<uchar>(lhs[0] + rhs[0]);
			dst.at<Vec3b>(row, col)[1] = saturate_cast<uchar>(lhs[1] + rhs[1]);
			dst.at<Vec3b>(row, col)[2] = saturate_cast<uchar>(lhs[2] + rhs[2]);
		}
	}
	imshow("saturate castä¹˜æ³•", dst);
}

åˆ©ç”¨GUIç”Ÿæˆæ»šåŠ¨æ¡ï¼Œæ”¹å˜å›¾åƒäº®åº¦â€”â€”Trackar
